column4: to my surprised, i installed Ubuntu as ext3. but ubuntu is able to read my MS Vista partitions NTFS.  THats amazing.  I didnt know it could do that.  Is this a new feature in Edgy because Dapper wasnt able to
dapper could do it... probably not automatic or something though :)
ok
/etc/X11/xorg.conf
ty :)
ubuntu only installs the open source "nv" drivers
so i need to install the proper Nvidia drivers also?
don't "need" to :)
so I follow the instructions on https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto ?
dont need to what?
if you want acceleration, you need to isntall it... but you don't "need" to, you just want to :)
yeah that guide's good
how can I safeguard myself in case ubuntu X doesnt load after I install the nvida drivers?
write that second command down
the one with -phigh
It will redo your xorg.conf if you mess it up  :)
so if it messes up, ubuntu will still load?
ubuntu will always load...
that second command will redo your xorg.conf if you mess that up
ctrl+alt+f1 gets you to a terminal
so i type sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh ?
log in... type that command then "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart" and you have your gui back :)
so it messes up and ubuntu doeant load anymore. I run Ubuntu and press ctr+alt+f1 and type sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh in a terminal;?
yes, then "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart" to get X to restart
when do I hit ctr+alt+f1 as ubuntu loads?
no... if it breaks it will give you a blue screen with errors, do it then.
ok
Don't you love answering your own questions :)
last request pls, can u quickly look at my sources.list and tell me if thats ok?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9905/
yes :)
uuu an aussie
from Sydney AU :)
is that sourcses list ok to use for edgy?
does it include all security updates etc?
that looks perfect :) Even if it is all over the place :P
ok thanks :)
if something isn't right it'll shout at you

it shouted at me :(  it says 4 lines of W: Duplicate sources.list entry http://security.ubuntu.com edgy-security/restricted Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/security.ubuntu.com_ubunu_dists_edgy-security_restricted_binary-i386_Packages)
don't worry... that's just a grumble. Carry on and we'll fix that later
can u pls tell me what lines need fixing?  besides you said it was perfect :P heh
you could just replace it with a "clean" sources.list ?
where can I get a clean sources for Edgy?
does that include universe etc?
everything :)
as i said earlier, that's just a grumble. It can carry on with the duplicates.
im a percectionist :)
it should tell you the range it suggests
if you're that worried... don't torrent. This is the internet, your isp can find out everything
no worried, just trying to set it best i can
sounds good
can u tell me pls?
what does it suggest?
doesnt suggest anything
Rather than communicating directly with the video hardware, the X server may be configured to perform some operations, such as video mode switching,
nothing else?
it says use it or not
In theory, either approach should work, but in practice, sometimes one does and the other does not.  Enabling this option is the safe bet, but feel
I think we've found our answer :)
what is it? :)
Use kernel framebuffer device interface?    Yes or No? :)
oh come on.... read it and tell me which you think you should do :)
YES
why? :)
it says in theory safest
X.Org server modules that should be loaded by default.  Shall  chose them all?
leave it as it is...
its chosing them all, but not dbe   : enables the double-buffering extension in the server.
should I chose dbe?
enable it
done
Attempt monitor autodetection?
yup
I'm wondering why you're getting all these questions?
no idea.  but its asking me
im about to reboot.  if X doesnt start, can I just restore the backup xorg.conf that I copied?
yes
brb i hope
it worked :)  but resolution is only 1024x768. How can I make it 1280x800?
I'm not sure sorry
ty :)  it works now!  wow, screen looks amazing
i followed your instructions :)
And I had to sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-generic
http://ping.windowsdream.com/  <-- any good?
lol ok :)
if my cuurent grub goes bad.  how do I reinstall it?  can I do that from the Kbuntu alternative CD?
definitely
do I chose rescue?
I think the Kbutunu CD has rescue. does it?
yes, and skip to the grub part
and it will reinstall grub and boot as before?
should :)
is grub always the same?
it works it out and should reinstall... easiest to do with a live cd really.
install tvtime to see if that automatically works with you tvtuner
tvtime, ok ty brb
ok :)
